name: vscode-gif-recorder
description: Record your VS Code actions and export them as GIFs

vscode-gif-recorder.outputDirectory.markdownDescription: Default directory used when prompting to save a recording. Use an absolute path, `~` for the home directory, or a path relative to the first workspace folder.

enumDescriptions: Octree - Generally produces smaller files, better for screen recordings with solid colors
NeuQuant - Neural network based, better for photographic content
vscode-gif-recorder.algorithm.description: Algorithm used for GIF color quantization

vscode-gif-recorder.useOptimizer.description: Enable optimizer to reduce file size by reusing color tables for similar frames

vscode-gif-recorder.optimizerThreshold.description: Optimizer threshold percentage (0-100). Higher values enable more aggressive optimization.

vscode-gif-recorder.quality.description: GIF encoding quality (1-20). Lower values result in lower visual quality and smaller files, while higher values produce better visual quality but larger files.

vscode-gif-recorder.fps.description: Frame rate for GIF recording (5-30 FPS). Lower FPS reduces file size but may appear less smooth. Recommended: 10-15 FPS for screen recordings.

enumDescriptions: High Quality - Best visual quality, larger file size (Quality: 15, FPS: 15)
Balanced - Good balance between quality and file size (Quality: 10, FPS: 10) - Default
Small File - Smallest file size, acceptable quality (Quality: 5, FPS: 8)
Custom - Use custom quality and FPS settings
vscode-gif-recorder.qualityPreset.description: Quality preset that automatically configures quality, FPS, and optimization settings. Select 'custom' to use individual settings.

vscode-gif-recorder.deduplicateFrames.description: Skip duplicate or nearly-identical consecutive frames to reduce file size. Highly recommended for screen recordings with static content.

vscode-gif-recorder.deduplicationThresho.description: Frame similarity threshold percentage (90-100). Frames more similar than this threshold will be considered duplicates. Higher values are more strict (99 = 99% similar to be considered duplicate).

vscode-gif-recorder.maxWidth.description: Maximum width for the output GIF in pixels. Set to 0 to disable scaling. If the captured frames exceed this width, they will be scaled down proportionally.

scripts.package: pnpm run compile && pnpm exec vsce package
